name: Objectives
description: Marsh is land that never decided whether it wanted to be earth or water and resents anyone who tries to cross it. Ground sucks at boots, fog hides distance, and every pool might be a shallow puddle or a bottomless, root-choked grave.

tableData.result: Find the safe path before night
Harvest the glowing reeds without waking things
Drive stakes to claim this sinking ground
Drown a rival where marsh remembers
Follow the corpse-lights to their source
Drag a wagon through without losing wheels
Sink an idol deep beneath the peat
Track the vanished hunters into blind fog
Appease the mud with blood and song
Recover bones swallowed by jealous roots
Burn back the reeds to reveal truth
Carry a message where roads have drowned
Guard the ferry as shadows gather
Lead the lost child out of the mire
Smother the campfire before fog notices
Cut a causeway from dead timber
Poison the pools with sacred rot
Find the whispering spring under black water
Anchor the drifting shrine to firm ground
Hunt the thing that walks on lilies
Silence the frogs that chant your name
Bury forbidden cargo where footprints vanish
Rescue the sinking horse before it screams
Chart the hidden sinkholes with sacrificed birds
Steal eggs from the great marsh predator
Escort pilgrims across during rising flood
Test each step for hollow lies
Confront the hermit who drinks the fog
Collect rare moss that grows on corpses
Lure pursuers into the hungry quagmire
Cut loose the boat haunted by weeds
Hide until the mist forgets you
Reach the stone circle before tide returns
Sever the roots strangling the old well
Smuggle contraband through leech-choked channels
Light beacons to mislead approaching strangers
Recover the drowned book of bindings
Capture the will-o-wisp in iron glass
Trace the distant bell through shifting bog
Survive the night on the sinking islet
Dam the black runoff from deeper swamps
Deliver offerings to the mud-buried altar
Plant cursed seeds in the wet furrows
Unmask the shape moving beneath the surface
Scout for higher ground before stormbreak
Free the prisoner staked in rising water
Follow blood trails that float on puddles
Lead monsters astray through mirrored pools
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

name: Atmosphere
description: Marsh is land that never decided whether it wanted to be earth or water and resents anyone who tries to cross it. Ground sucks at boots, fog hides distance, and every pool might be a shallow puddle or a bottomless, root-choked grave.

tableData.result: Breath thickens to drinkable fog
Mud sighs like something half asleep
Rot-sweet wind clings to tongues
Silence drowns even whispered prayers
Distant croaks echo like mocking laughter
Lantern light swallowed by crawling mist
Every step answers with a gurgle
Cold vapors bead on bare steel
Reeds shiver without a hint of breeze
Stagnant pools exhale feverish warmth
Sky reduced to a smudged smear
The world ends five paces ahead
Shadows drift across water without source
Air reeks of drowned, forgotten seasons
Insects hum a single, needling note
Wet earth pulses beneath your tread
Faint glow worms sketch treacherous paths
Muck clutches like grasping, jealous hands
Fog rolls in slow, deliberate curls
Distant lights bob with predatory patience
Every ripple hints at something rising
Wind carries muffled, pleading sobs
Moss-slick trunks lean in to listen
Dark water mirrors only a stranger
The hush feels watchful, newly broken
Reeds hiss secrets in a dead tongue
Air tastes of iron and mildew
Frogs fall suddenly, impossibly, silent
Bubbles break mud like stifled screams
Twisting vapors coil around exposed skin
The horizon dissolves into colorless haze
Damp cold settles inside your bones
Every smell is rot in new shapes
Uneven ground shifts like a breathing chest
Soft rain disturbs nothing, changes nothing
Mist swallows sound, births strange echoes
Pools gleam like open, watching eyes
Darkness gathers early between leaning reeds
Sucking mud mimics the beat of hearts
Low thunder rumbles beneath the surface
Pale fungi cast bruised, sickly halos
Air thrums with unseen wingbeats overhead
Roots knot into suggestive, broken shapes
Stillness presses down, heavy as water
Your breath steams in oddly colored plumes
Far splashes mark slow, circling approaches
Distant marsh lights flicker, then wait
Every direction smells faintly of graves
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

name: Locations
description: Marsh is land that never decided whether it wanted to be earth or water and resents anyone who tries to cross it. Ground sucks at boots, fog hides distance, and every pool might be a shallow puddle or a bottomless, root-choked grave.

tableData.result: Broken causeway sinking into jealous mud
Willow-choked island whispering with trapped breath
Black reeds circling a blind, warm pool
Sunken shrine tilting in peat-stained water
Rotten boardwalk vanishing into milk-white fog
Stone cairns half-swallowed by hungry bog
Lantern-lit ferry tied to no shore
Abandoned camp, footprints filling slowly with ooze
Drowned field of scarecrows grown moldy tongues
Croaking pit where frogs echo human words
Hollow hill weeping rust from buried chains
Bleached ribcage arching above stagnant channel
Quaking mire humming with unseen wings
Lean-to shack perched on root-knotted stilts
Thorn-walled islet carpeted in bone-white moss
Slick stepping-stones that shift under blood
Fog-locked crossroads marked by sinking stones
Dead tree bridge sagging over black rill
Slumped watchtower listing into reed-clogged ditch
Cluster of skulls stacked as waymarkers
Fungal meadow breathing out sweet rot
Whirlpool disguised as placid rain-pocked pool
Buried road glimpsed between sucking footprints
Ring of cattails hiding still, glassy eye
Collapsed burrow exhaling cold, graveyard air
Tangle of roots cradling a drowned altar
Circle of stepping logs, some not wood
Mudflat veined with faintly glowing veins
Leaning gallows post wrapped in strangler vines
Drift of bloated carcasses forming a causeway
Shimmering mirage of dry land, always distant
Sunken bell tower tolling beneath the water
Leech-thick channel where current pulls upward
Isolated knoll crowned with whispering reed idols
Sodden battlefield, weapons rusted into peat
Burial mound leaking candle-yellow swampfire
Cluster of huts on stilts, all empty
Pool ringed with footprints facing inward
Chasm of roots yawning beneath thin crust
Patch of unnaturally still, reflectionless bog
Trail of woven reeds spanning bottomless slough
Sinkhole gulping down a slowly tilting tree
Moss-draped archway leading into green twilight
Narrow ridge of firmer ground, recently chewed
Stone circle sinking one pillar each dusk
Ferry landing without river, boat, or tracks
Shattered idol face half-buried in sucking mire
CONNECTION WEB
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

Bleached antlers tangled in black reeds

Footprints fill slowly with pale fire
Wicker cage bobbing, bones rattling softly
Rusting helm cradled by carnivorous lilies

Leeches spelling crude runes on skin

Corpse-light hovering over an unseen drop

Totem of stitched frogs and feathers

Fallen idol, face eroded into skull

Obsidian shard humming when near water

Half-buried bell that rings underwater

Torn banner nailed to a living tree
Bridge of ribs arching over sludge

Shadow of a tower, no tower
Single dry hill crowned with fresh grave

Reed flute playing itself in still air
Trail of blood that never dilutes

Mud idol wearing a familiar expression

name: Banes
description: Marsh is land that never decided whether it wanted to be earth or water and resents anyone who tries to cross it. Ground sucks at boots, fog hides distance, and every pool might be a shallow puddle or a bottomless, root-choked grave.

tableData.result: Leeches spell forgotten names in blood
Sodden ground exhales choking grave gas
Fog hides antlered shapes that listen
Roots knot around ankles, tasting pulse
Black water mirrors a rotting future
Will-o-wisps lure breath from lungs
Bog bubbles whisper bargains to bones
Reeds slice skin like hungry tongues
Pale hands reach from peat below
Insects crawl beneath eyelids, drinking sight
Mud hardens suddenly, stone around feet
Every splash calls something watching nearer
Sunlight drowns before touching the water
Rot-sweet air dulls thought, sharpens hunger
Ghost lights circle, tightening like noose
Croaking chorus speaks in cursed omens
Thin crust collapses into sucking void
Vines slither, imitating warmth and veins
Dead trees lean closer with each breath
Shallow puddle opens into endless drop
Blood dripped here grows whispering lilies
Mist clings, feeding on warmth and courage
Fetid pools hatch glass-toothed tadpoles
Lost paths rearrange while backs are turned
Every footprint fills with watching eyes
Carrion birds roost on still-living shoulders
Waterlogged corpses rise, bloated yet eager
Rusting weapons fuse to grasping cattails
Marsh gas ignites around spoken secrets
Shadowed ripples follow, never breaking surface
Thorns inject dreams of drowning slowly
Sludge creeps higher, craving open mouths
Invisible insects hum loud inside skull
Tangled roots drink memories through bare skin
Lurking shapes move only when unobserved
Slick stones tilt toward hidden chasms
Every breath tastes of someone else's death
Dragonflies stitch eyelids shut while sleeping
Reeds whisper true names to the mire
Black lilies bloom where courage fails
Footsteps echo from beneath the water
Marshlight reveals wounds never actually suffered
Slime molds sketch maps to shallow graves
Distant splashing mimics familiar loved voices
Hands emerge offering help, demanding flesh
Crawling mist erases tracks and memories
Something laughs softly beneath each bubbling
The marsh remembers every trespass in blood

name: Boons
description: Marsh is land that never decided whether it wanted to be earth or water and resents anyone who tries to cross it. Ground sucks at boots, fog hides distance, and every pool might be a shallow puddle or a bottomless, root-choked grave.

tableData.result: Reedmask that filters poison and whispers
Leech-kissed blood now rejects all venoms
Mud hardens to stone beneath your step
Boglight hovers, loyal as a hound
Reeds part for you like sullen curtains
You breathe fog as others breathe air
Marsh insects ignore your warm flesh
Roots cradle your fall like patient hands
Your voice carries clearly through choking mist
You read omens in bubble patterns
Hands draw strength from cold sucking mud
Your shadow distracts hungry things below
Silt drinks your scent, erasing your trail
You stride waterlogged ground as weightless
Bog gas bends from your open flame
Hidden stepping-stones glow faintly at dusk
Slime that coats you dulls all pain
Every cattail hides a nourishing core
Frogs fall silent to warn of danger
You always find the firmest footing
Muck loosens its grip at your curse
Marsh birds guide you from unseen snares
Your reflection in black water lies
You feel corpses buried in the mire
Insects carry your whispered words afar
Your skin chills, untempting to parasites
Bogwater in your mouth becomes sweet
You sink without trace when you choose
When still, you resemble a rotted stump
Your footsteps sound like distant dripping
Snapping roots recoil from your bare feet
You taste iron whenever storm approaches
Marsh remembers your blood and spares it
Ghostly heron circles above your path
You walk all night without tiring
Cold vapors hide you from searching eyes
Sludge forms crude tools at your touch
Your spit sprouts fast-growing reed barriers
You hear drowning cries hours before
Glimmering beetles swarm to light your way
Your wounds close when washed in peat
You never misjudge depth of dark pools
Hungry leeches drop away at your hiss
Your breath summons harmless guiding will-o-wisps
Marsh beasts mistake you for their own
Rotting logs bear your weight unquestioning
You can drink any standing water
Thick fog opens a narrow corridor
DESCRIPTOR + FOCUS
ROLL TWICE
